results.title: Forbidden love: the unashamed stories of lesbian lives
results.creator_credit: Aerlyn Weissman, Lynne Fernie, Ginny Stikeman, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Against a backdrop of bookcovers from lurid lesbian pulp novels, “Forbidden Love” paints a compelling and often hilarious portrait of lesbian sexuality and survival in Canada in the 1950’s and 60’s when lesbian love was consigned to the twilight world of silence and exile. Ten women tell their own stories of first loves and life in the clandestine subculture with the candour of true survivors. Due to the explicit nature of certain scenes, viewer discretion is advised.

results.title: The Writing on the screen
results.creator_credit: Carol Stowe, Lois Bianchi, Mark Anderson, Granada Television International, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Shape of the world”.
Modern mapping technologies enable us to compile information on everything from earthquakes, AIDS epidemics and mineral exploration to the structure of the human brain. The mapping of our planet’s physical features is now complete, but its future well-being is largely in our hands. Using remote sensing technologies we can map changes in the natural world, and chart the warning signals - but will we use this knowledge to prevent disaster before it is too late?

results.title: Beating about the bush
results.creator_credit: Caroline Sherwood, Nicholas Adler and Titus Films
results.brief_description: The film follows the tour of Djaambi, a half Aboriginal, half white, urban band from Melbourne, under the leadership of Richard Frankland as they travel to remote Aboriginal communities in outback Australia. It explores the cultural mix within the band and the culture shock all members of the band, particularly the Aboriginal members, experience as they meet another, very different side of their culture. Towards the end of the tour the various problems and cultural confusions become focused in a radical split between the white film makers and the more vocal Aboriginal band members. A disturbing look at good intentions gone wrong.

results.title: Deep in my heart
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Roger Edens and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This film ‘biopic’ portrays the life of composer Sigmund Romberg, whose scores included “The Desert Song” and “Maytime”. While Broadway swings to the jazzy beat of ragtime, Romberg chooses to play the beautiful waltzes of his native country. When Romberg is convinced by the owner of the Cafe Vienna to try his hand at ragtime he writes a hit song in no time at all. Romberg writes one smash hit after another and eventually creates a hit show that takes Broadway by storm. Based on the book by Elliot Arnold. Stars Jose Ferrer, Merle Oberon, Helen Traubel, Walter Pidgeon with special guest appearances by Ann Miller, Rosemary Clooney, Cyd Charisse, Gene Kelly and Howard Keel.

results.title: Introducing the Eucalypts
results.creator_credit: Paul Broady and Video Education Australia
results.brief_description: This program covers the main features of our Eucalypts: their identifying characteristics (especially the bark, flower buds and leaves), adaptability, distribution patterns, growth and type of timber produced, and their human and non-human uses.

results.title: Future wave: Japan design
results.brief_description: This documentary explores, through example and personal reflection, the economics, aesthetics, personalities, and traditional spiritual links that translate so spectacularly into Japanese design.

results.title: Talkin' about Aids
results.creator_credit: Eleanore Lindo, Daphne Ballon, Rachel Low, Atlanta Film Production and Great Northern Release Company
results.brief_description: A refreshing fast paced pastiche of rap, drama animation and interviews. This program dispels many of the popular myths about AIDS and HIV and presents the facts impartially, but also at times with a touch of humour. The main emphasis is on preventative behaviour and includes not only information about safe sex and needle sharing, but focuses on the issue of personal responsibility and making the right choices. Includes moving interviews with AIDS sufferers, high school students and a guest appearance by Pat Mastroianni (Joey) from Degrassi High.

results.title: Sex: a guide for the young (E)
results.creator_credit: Svend Johansen, Filmforsyningen and Multimedia Group of Canada
results.brief_description: This very frank and explicit animated video covers many aspects of sexuality in an entertaining and educational way. The program was made in Denmark where they don’t ‘beat around the bush’ on the topic of sex. The program uses a general question and answer approach; answering many questions which may often be asked by young people. It touches on anatomy, sexuality, hygiene, contraception, AIDS and STD’s, condoms, orgasms, homosexuality, relationships, masturbation, just to name a few. WARNING: THE MATERIAL IS VISUALLY EXPLICIT.

results.title: Broken journey: mending dreams
results.brief_description: A powerful and moving documentary about a family in search of itself. After 18 years in Australia, photographer Hanh Tran is making his first journey home to Vietnam. It’s a dream that has finally come true. Amidst the reunion of tears and laughter, an extraordinary family saga emerges. This film is not only a personal picture of Hanh and his family, but it also about life in contemporary Vietnam - a society in transition.
